DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of relevant process for preparing a sample or portion of a sample for storage, preservation, or further analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The relation of something to the matter at hand._The process of preparing a sample or portion of a sample for storage, preservation, or further analysis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: The relation of something to the matter at hand.:The process of preparing a sample or portion of a sample for storage, preservation, or further analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The process of preparing a sample or portion of a sample for storage, preservation, or further analysis._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.

Concepts.definition: The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase when the temperature is lowered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.

Concepts.definition: The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.
